1.text: If therefore any consolation in Christ, if any encouragement of love, if any mutual participation of the Spirit, if any compassions and mercies,

2.text: Fill ye up my joy, that ye may have the same in mind, having the same love, unanimous, being one in mind.

3.text: Nothing by hired labor, or vainglory; but in lowliness the leaders hold each other above themselves.

4.text: Look ye each not on the things of themselves, but also each the things of others.

5.text: For let this be in mind among you, which also in Christ Jesus;

6.text: Who, being in the form of God, thought not robbery to be equal to God.

7.text: But emptied himself, taking the form of a servant, born in the likeness of men:

8.text: And found in fashion as man, he humbled himself, being obedient until death, and the death of the cross.

9.text: Wherefore God has also exceedingly exalted him, and favored him as a gift with a name above every name:

10.text: That in the name of Jesus every knee should bend, of the heavenlies, and of terrestrial things, and things under earth

11.text: And every tongue should avow that the Lord is Jesus Christ, to the glory of the Father.

12.text: Therefore, my beloved, as ye have always listened, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, with fear and tremor effect your own salvation.

13.text: For God is working in you also to will and to work by benevolence.

14.text: Do ye all things without murmurings and discussions:

15.text: That ye be complete and pure, children of God, blameless in the midst of a crooked and perverted generation, among whom ye appear as luminaries in the world;

16.text: Holding on to the word of life; for boasting to me in the day of Christ, for I ran not in vain, nor was I wearied in vain.

17.text: But if also I am poured out upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I rejoice, and rejoice together with you all.

18.text: And do ye also rejoice at the same, and rejoice together with me.

19.text: And I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy quickly to you, that I also be courageous, having known the things concerning you.

20.text: For I have none having a like soul, who naturally will have care for the things concerning you.

21.text: For they all seek the things of themselves, and not the things of Christ Jesus.

22.text: And ye know his proof, that, as a child to a father, he served with me in the good news.

23.text: Him therefore I truly hope to send, whenever I shall see from it the things concerning me.

24.text: And I have trusted in the Lord that I myself also shall come quickly.

25.text: And I thought necessary Epaphroditus, my brother, and cooperator, and fellow-soldier, and your sent, and workman of my necessity, be sent to you.

26.text: Since he was longing for you all, and harassed because ye heard that he was sick.

27.text: For also he was sick near to death: but God compassionated him; and not him only, but also me, lest I should have grief upon grief.

28.text: Therefore I sent him the more earnestly, that, seeing him, ye might again rejoice, and I be more free from sorrow.

29.text: Therefore receive him in the Lord with all joy; and hold such esteemed.

30.text: Because for the work of Christ he drew near to death, having exposed the soul to danger, that he might fill up your want of service to me.
